newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan money rates sink despite NCD issue.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan money rates sink despite NCD issue.

text.p: Taiwan's money rates sank at mid-session on Friday as market liquidity remained loose despite the central bank's issue of T$5 billion in Negotiable Certificates of Deposit on Thursday, dealers said.

The overnight interbank rate was at 5.083 percent against Thursday's 5.129 close, with 30-day commercial paper at 5.10-5.15 percent against 5.15. Dealers expected rates to hover around the current low levels for the rest of the session.
In the bond market, the 10-year 86/4 bond yield was at 6.1275 against 6.1125. -- Rachel Lee (5080815)
